demos.name: Sparse Grid Interpolation
demos.description:
The following demos illustrate the most important features of the Sparse Grid Interpolation Toolbox.

IMPORTANT NOTE: The toolbox must be initialized prior to executing these demos by using the command spinit from the Matlab command line, or by clicking here.

website.a: Sparse Grid Interpolation Toolbox Web site

demosection.label: Piecewise multilinear and polynomial sparse grids

demoitem.label: cmpgrids - Compare the avalailable sparse grid types
spdemo - Interpolate a simple two-dimensional function
spdemovarout - Interpolate a function with multiple output arguments
spcompare - Compare error plots for the test functions of Gerz
spcomparepoly - Error plots for multilinear vs. polynomial basis functions
spcomparederiv - Error plots for computing gradients of sparse grid interpolants
spadaptdemo - Dimension-adaptive interpolation of a simple two-dimensional function
spadapterror - Compares the error: adaptive vs. non-adaptive
timespvals - Measure the performance of the hierarchical construction of the interpolant
timespvalsdct - Measure and compare the performance of the DCT-based spvals algorithm
timespinterp - Measure the performance of computing interpolated values
timespderiv - Measure the performance of computing derivatives
